required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Development Study to Evaluate a Nasal Mask for the Treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea
clinical_study.official_title: A Development Study to Evaluate a Nasal Mask for the Treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea

brief_summary.textblock: This investigation is designed to evaluate the comfort, ease of use and performance of a trial nasal mask for the treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) in the home environment.

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigation is a prospective, non-randomized, non-blinded study. Up to 45 OSA patients who currently use a nasal or nasal pillows mask will be recruited
This study will involve a baseline (Visit One) data gathering with the participant's PAP therapy and their usual mask. This will be followed by the participants being fitted with the trial nasal mask for use in-home (Visit Two). The participant then will come in to return the mask (Visit Three) and give feedback on their experience using the mask in home in the form of a structured interview during Visit Three. The maximum amount of time the participants will be exposed to the trial mask in-home will be 14 ± 5 days from Visit Two.
The mask and CPAP (if used from the loan research pool) will be returned to the institution at the conclusion of the trial and participant will return to their usual mask and therapy device for the treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea.
Neither the investigators nor the participants will be blinded to the study.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: After a period of baseline, all enrolled participants will be put on the same trial mask.

primary_outcome.description: Determined from questionnaires and a sleep diary - Subjective
Determined from data recorded from the PAP device - Objective
Determined from questionnaires and a sleep diary - Subjective

secondary_outcome.description: Leak data recorded from PAP device - Objective
Sizing tool designed for Saturn Nasal Mask
Data recorded from PAP device - Objective

arm_group.description: Participants will be placed on this arm for a total of 14 ± 5 days from Visit 2. Participants will be using the trial nasal mask during this treatment arm.

intervention.description: Participants will be placed on this arm for a total of 14 ± 5 days from Visit 2. Participants will be using the trial nasal mask during this treatment arm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- AHI ≥ 5 from diagnostic PSG night
- Aged 22 and over (FDA defined as adult)
- Either prescribed APAP, CPAP or Bi-Level PAP for OSA
- Existing nasal or nasal pillows mask users (preferable 70%:30% split)
- Fluent in spoken and written English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to give informed consent
- Patient intolerant to CPAP therapy
- Anatomical or physiological conditions making PAP therapy inappropriate
- Current diagnosis of respiratory disease or CO2 retention
- Pregnant or think they may be pregnant

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will not be shared with any other researchers or parties.
